reviewText: I own this film and have watched it many times. In some ways it blends the ideas of Green Card and Taming of the Shrew (Hence the name Catalina for Laura Harring's character). reviewText: I got suckered into watching this movie because it had 3 stars.  However, it is terrible and a complete waste of your time. The only way to watch this is with a group of slightly drunk friends so you can all make fun of it.The plot is OK for a silly romantic comedy, and it has the occasional clever point. However, every single person in this movie is a terrible, horrible actor. Almost every scene has someone throwing a fit or heavily overacting.It is a nice touch that the landscapers pretend to speak poor English and then roll their eyes at the pompous rich people when they leave. But we're supposed to believe the sister is straight from Mexico and she has NO accent whatsoever?  She has better English language skills than the people on my block! OK, so if the movie is trying to make a point why, to the other extreme, do some actors play the stereotypical immigrant so heavily that it is just painful/embarrassing to watch?I couldn't watch the whole movie because the acting was so bad. There weren't "characters" or "people" in a story. This was a bunch of 'actors' waving their arms around and reciting lines/yelling. You could tell what was going on without any sound: "Look at me I am really mad you can tell because of my very mad face and the way I am slamming this book down!" "I am drunk. Look at how drunk I am. You can tell because I am staggering around and have a goofy expression on my face."  I've seen better acting in high school plays.I would give this movie negative stars if possible to try to get the rating down to where it belongs.

reviewText: This is an entertaining but mild love-hate comedy starring the lovely & talented Laura Harring in a lead role. She plays a hot-tempered & strong-willed Latina woman who marries for a green card. She's not at all the monster that she's made out to be by her brother - singer "Gerardo". It's probably the director's fault for not having her play the role to the hilt. This is the only flaw of the film. That would have been fun to watch, and allowed Ms. Harring to stretch her acting skills. However, her character here comes across as generally sweet and sort of like mild salsa. There's no vindictiveness - think of how good "War of the Roses" was with Michael Douglas & Kathleen Turner. Yet, it's nice to see Laura in all her gorgeous beauty for 90 minutes here rather in brief supporting roles where she only gets a few seconds of camera time. The chemistry between the leads is pretty good. The singer formerly known as "Gerardo" is excellent as the bossy brother-in-law. I especially liked the scene where he goes in for an image make-over and the hairstylist wants to shave off his moustache. Overall, it's a satisfying comedy but could have been better if the script called for more of a battle between the sexes. If you want to watch a hysterical and truly vindictive love-hate relationship, pick up "Love Stinks" starring Frenchie Stewart and Brigitte Wilson.

reviewText: First of all forget My Big Fat Greek Wedding! You might get the wrong impression that Loco Love is similar to that funny little movie that surprised and amused a lot of viewers, but in reality the only similarity lies in the fact that both movies deal with cultural differences and marriage.Loco Love has one of the poorest and humourless scripts I have seen in a long while, and tries too hard to extract laughter, but delivering the most painful sitting outside a dentist chair.The wealthy wife of a man ditches him and leaves him penniless and jobless out of her family restaurant business.In comes his lottery winner hispanic gardener offering to buy him a restaurant of his own if he agrees to marry his fiery sister, desperate for a green card. Promising plot, and with the right director and writer it could have turned out to be an enjoyable light comedy, even though the story itself is not original and its ending quite predictable..(surely enough the man falls in love with his 'bride' and all live happily ever after)..But let me give you an example of how awful the script is,The wife when ditching her husband takes the lucrative restaurant business he was a manager in, but leaves him the big house?!!The lottery winner decides inexplicably to move in with his family in that house..I would have thought winning 62 million dollars would buy you the whole street instead of sharing your accomodation??!!!The sister,played by Laura Harring, is portrayed to be a 'monster' that no man can 'tame' by her own family! but then turns out to be as fiery and tempered as your average Latina woman, and not quite that monster we are led to believe she was.I am sure Roy Werner is an able actor, but was terribly miscat for the man's role! (In my opinion this character needed a more naively and sweetly funny actor.)So save your dollars and forget the lure of My Big Fat Greek Wedding, and of sizziling latin fun, for the only hot moment in Loco Love is when the credits roll.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This movie is better than what I expected. It is about a rich and then arrogant guy (Roy Werner) who is forced to marry his business associate's sister Catalina (Laura Herring) so that he can save his restaurant. At first, they hate or despise each other and then their feelings eventually change between each other. The only obstacles they have to deal with are her brother and his ex-wife. At the end, I was so pleased for what he did in order to fight and prove his love for Catalina and nothing else matters.It is worth to see and buy for your DVD and video collection.
summary: The Best Romantic Drama Movie I Have Seen Lately

reviewText: I enjoyed this light romantic comedy even though portions of it were predictablel.  The lead actor Ms. Harring was really good and she has a smile that lights the stage.  Her counter part did a good job as a stiff, somewhat stuck up guy who needs to re-learn some of his habits about life and relationships.  It's worth the time to watch even though it's not a wide-screen movie.  Image quality was good.
summary: Light romantic comedy that's fun to watch for the performances of the two leads
